intro: Ardisia jinyunensis, commonly known as the Yinyun beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to China, specifically the Yunnan province, and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are followed by bright red berries, which are an important food source for various bird species. Ardisia jinyunensis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some horticultural settings.
